refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Certificate chooser allows for selection of a certificate or various schemes optionally accompanied with a key and passwords or PIN.
The widgets that implement this interface may allow selecting the certificates from various sources such as files or cryptographic tokens.

refsect2.title: nma_cert_chooser_add_to_size_group ()
refsect2.para: Adds the labels to the specified size group so that they are aligned nicely with other entries in a form.
It is expected that the NMACertChooser is a GtkGrid with two columns with the labels in the first one.

refsect2.title: nma_cert_chooser_validate ()
refsect2.para: Validates whether the chosen values make sense. The users can do further validation by subscribing to the "*-changed" signals and returning an error themselves.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if validation passes, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: enum NMACertChooserFlags
refsect2.para: Flags that controls what is the certificate chooser button able to pick. Currently only local files are supported, but might be extended to use URIs, such as PKCS#11 certificate URIs in future as well.

entry.para: Only pick a certificate, not a key
Hide all controls but the secrets entries
Ensure the chooser only selects regular PEM files

refsect2.title: The cert-password-validate signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the certificate password needs validation. The handlers can indicate that the password is invalid by returning an error, which blocks further signal processing and causes a call to nma_cert_chooser_validate() to fail.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The cert-validate signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the certificate needs validation. The handlers can indicate that the certificate is invalid by returning an error, which blocks further signal processing and causes a call to nma_cert_chooser_validate() to fail.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The changed signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when anything changes in the certificate chooser, be it a certificate, a key or associated passwords.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The key-password-validate signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the key password needs validation. The handlers can indicate that the password is invalid by returning an error, which blocks further signal processing and causes a call to nma_cert_chooser_validate() to fail.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The key-validate signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the key needs validation. The handlers can indicate that the key is invalid by returning an error, which blocks further signal processing and causes a call to nma_cert_chooser_validate() to fail.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
